thread.title: RB Royce Freeman is on pace to break some significant records at Oregon
thread.title_full: RB Royce Freeman is on pace to break some significant records at Oregon

author: Here's What Westboro Thinks of Kim Davis
title: RB Royce Freeman is on pace to break some significant records at Oregon
text:
RB Royce Freeman is on pace to break some significant records at Oregon FOXSports 54 mins ago Â© Scott Olmos-USA TODAY Sports Sep 6, 2014; Eugene, OR, USA; Oregon Ducks running back Royce Freeman (21) runs the ball against the Michigan State Spartans at Autzen Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Scott Olmos-USA TODAY Sports After rushing for 138 yards on 27 carries in Oregon's 26-20 victory over Washington, sophomore RB Royce Freeman is to set a number of single-season records at Oregon.Freeman has rushed for over 100 yards in five of Oregon's seven games this season and is averaging 142.4 yards per game this season, which ranks fourth in the FBS. On the season, Freeman has rushed for 997 yards and nine touchdowns.
AdChoices If Oregon is able to make a bowl game -- the Ducks need two more wins to become eligible -- Freeman would have a chance to set Oregon's single-season rushing record, which is held by LaMike James.
James rushed for 1,805 yards in 2011 and averaged 150.4 yards per game on the ground.
(h/t The Oregonian )
